intro: Julbernardia pellegriniana, commonly known as the African mahogany, is a tropical tree native to Central and Eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Caesalpiniaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and dense canopy. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are followed by elongated, woody pods containing flat, winged seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and timber, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
